tests.description: Check that the minimum expected things are found in the server CapabilityStatement

tests.name: term-caps

tests.description: Expansion containing all the code system

tests.name: simple-expand-inactive
tests.description: Expansion containing only the inactive codes in the code system

tests.name: simple-expand-enum
tests.description: Expansion containing an enumerated set of codes in the code system

tests.name: simple-expand-enum-bad
tests.description: Expansion containing an enumerated set of codes in the code system, including invalid codes

tests.name: simple-expand-isa
tests.description: Expansion containing a filter on the code system using is-a relationship

tests.name: simple-expand-isa-o2
tests.description: Expansion containing a filter on the code system using is-a relationship with paging (tx.fhir.org internal test)

tests.name: simple-expand-isa-c2
tests.description: Expansion containing a filter on the code system using is-a relationship with paging (tx.fhir.org internal test)

tests.name: simple-expand-isa-o2c2
tests.description: Expansion containing a filter on the code system using is-a relationship with paging (tx.fhir.org internal test)

tests.name: simple-expand-prop
tests.description: Expansion containing a filter on the code system using a property value

tests.name: simple-expand-regex
tests.description: Expansion containing a filter on the code system using regex on the codes

tests.name: simple-expand-regex2
tests.description: Expansion containing a filter on the code system using regex on the codes using a regex known to cause a problem on at least one server

tests.name: simple-lookup-1
tests.description: Check that $lookup works (there's not many tests for $lookup because it's not used much by the tools)

tests.name: simple-lookup-2
tests.description: Check that $lookup works (there's not many tests for $lookup because it's not used much by the tools)

suites.name: parameters
suites.description: Testing out the various expansion parameters that the IG publisher makes use of

tests.name: parameters-expand-all-hierarchy
tests.description: Expand an entire code system, and check that the code system replicates the hierarchy. Note that for all the hierarchical expansions, the flag 'flat' means that the server is not expected to provide a hierarchical expansion

tests.name: parameters-expand-enum-hierarchy
tests.description: Expand an enumerated value set - no hierarchy in this case

tests.name: parameters-expand-isa-hierarchy
tests.description: Expand an is-a value set, and preserve the hierarchy

tests.name: parameters-expand-all-active
tests.description: expand all the active codes - hierarchy is preserved

tests.name: parameters-expand-active-active
tests.description: Expand all the active codes, and specify active codes in a parameter

tests.name: parameters-expand-inactive-active
tests.description: Expand all the codes, including inactive ones, but specify active codes only in a parameter

tests.name: parameters-expand-enum-active
tests.description: Expand an enumerated value set, with active codes only in a parameter

tests.name: parameters-expand-isa-active
tests.description: Expand an is-a value set, only the active codes

tests.name: parameters-expand-all-inactive
tests.description: expand all the active codes, including inactive codes - hierarchy is preserved

suites.name: language
suites.description: Testing returning language by request, getting the right designation

suites.name: language2
suites.description: A series of tests that test display name validation for various permutations of languages

suites.name: extensions
suites.description: Testing proper handling of extensions, which depends on the extension

tests.name: validation-simple-codeableconcept-bad-version2
tests.description: Check that a bad system with a version doesn't generate a warning that the version can't be found

suites.name: big
suites.description: Testing handling a big code system

tests.explanation: This test is testing that a server can (a) defend itself against a request that is too big and (b) returns the correct response when it does. The test is termed in terms of 1000 codes, but the actual limit doesn't matter as long as it's... big enough (loose definition)

header.name: X-TOO-COSTLY-THRESHOLD
explanation: Ontoserver has an internal limit far above 1000 codes. That's fine, but we really want to know that if it's actual limit is exceeded,
it'll return the correct response. So we add this artificial header to tell Ontoserver to treat 1000 as an internal limit. This way we know
that if a real value set exceeds the internal cost limit, however that's determined, the response will be correctly understood

tests.name: big-echo-no-limit

suites.name: other
suites.description: Misc tests based on issues submitted by users

suites.name: tho
suites.description: Misc assorted test cases from tho

tests.name: direct-expand-one
tests.description: Test the actual value set directly - v1

tests.name: direct-expand-two

tests.name: indirect-expand-one

tests.name: indirect-expand-two
tests.description: Test the actual value set indirectly - v2

tests.name: indirect-expand-zero
tests.description: Test the actual value set indirectly - versionless

tests.name: indirect-expand-zero-pinned
tests.description: Test the actual value set indirectly - versionless, and specify a version

tests.name: indirect-expand-zero-pinned-wrong
tests.description: Test the actual value set indirectly - versionless, and specify a version that doesn't exist

suites.name: tx.fhir.org
suites.description: These are tx.fhir.org specific tests. There's no expectation that other servers will pass these tests, and they are not executed by default. (other servers can, but they depend on other set up not controlled by the tests
